{{Infobox rail line |name = Tamsui Line (æ·¡æ°´ç·) |image = Taipei_MRT_Jiantan_Station.jpg |caption = Jiantan Station |type = [[Rapid transit]] |locale = [[Taipei]] and [[New Taipei]], [[Taiwan]] |start = [[Tamsui Station|Tamsui]] |end = [[Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall Station|Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall]] |stations = 21 |open = March 28, 1997 |operator = [[Taipei Metro|Taipei Rapid Transit Corporation]] |character = Elevated, at-grade, underground |depot = Beitou Depot |stock = [[Kawasaki Heavy Industries|Kawasaki]] [[Taipei Metro C301|C301]], C371
3 cars per set, 2 sets per train |linelength = {{convert|23.2|km|mi|1|abbr=on}} |notrack = 2 |gauge = {{RailGauge|sg}} |speed = 80 km/h |el = [[Third rail]] (750 [[volt]]s [[Direct Current|DC]]) |map = {{infobox rdt|Tamsui Line (TRTS) RDT|navbar=1}} }} {{Chinese|t=æ·¡æ°´ç·|p=DÃ nshuÇ-XiÃ n|tp=DÃ nshuÄi-SiÃ n|w=Tan4-shui3- Hsien4|poj=TÄm-chÃºi-SÃ²aâ¿}} [[Image:TRTS Red Line.PNG|200px|thumb|right]] The [[Taipei Metro]] '''Tamsui Line''' (formerly the '''Danshui Line''') is a high-capacity underground, at-grade, and elevated line. The right-of-way was originally occupied by the conventional rail [[Tamsui Line (TRA)|Tamsui TRA Line]] of the [[Taiwan Railway Administration]], which closed in [[1988]]. The 23.2 km route includes 21 stations and the Beitou maintenance depot.{{cite web|url=http://www.dorts.gov.tw/english/Network/frame_stage1.htm|title=First Stage of Taipei MRT (already under Revenue Service)|publisher=Department of Rapid Transit Systems|date=2009-07-04|accessdate=2009-08-19}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Most of the stations along the Tamsui line are built in a traditional Chinese architectural style. Passengers from Tamsui require only 31 minutes to reach [[Taipei Main Station]], where transfers to both the [[Nangang Line (TRTS)|Nangang Line]] and the [[Banqiao Line (TRTS)|Banqiao Line]] can be made. The line opened for revenue service on December 25, 1997. On a southbound journey, trains leave from [[Tamsui Station|Tamsui]] and follow the right-of-way of the old Tamsui-Taipei railroad on an at-grade or elevated level through [[Beitou District|Beitou]], [[Shilin District|Shilin]] and Yuanshan, after which the line runs underground through to Taipei Main Station. The route then runs through to [[Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall Station|Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall]] and becomes the [[Xindian Line (TRTS)|Xindian Line]] or "green line," continuing service to Xindian Station, the southernmost station in the MRT system. ==History== *July [[1988]]: Tamsui Line begins construction. *March 28, 1997: Tamsui Line begins service from [[Tamsui Station|Tamsui]] to [[Zhongshan Station|Zhongshan]]. *December 25, 1997: The section from [[Zhongshan Station|Zhongshan]] to [[Taipei Main Station]] begins service. *December 24, 1998: The section from [[Taipei Main Station]] to [[Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall Station|Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall]] begins service. ==Rolling stock== Over the years, the Tamsui Line used different types of rolling stock. From the start, the line used C301 cars. In 1997, the C321 cars were introduced. In 2007, the newest cars, the C371 cars were used, replacing most of the C301 cars. ==Stations== {|class=wikitable !rowspan=2|Code!!colspan=2|Station Name!!rowspan=2|Transfer!!colspan=2 rowspan=2|Location |-align=center !English!![[Chinese Language|Chinese]] |-align=center bgcolor=red |colspan=7|'''Tamsui Line''' |-align=center |R33||[[Tamsui Station|Tamsui]]||æ·¡æ°´ | |rowspan=3|[[Tamsui District|Tamsui]]||rowspan=3|[[New Taipei]] |-align=center |R32||[[Hongshulin Station|Hongshulin]]||ç´æ¨¹æ | |-align=center |R31||[[Zhuwei Station|Zhuwei]]||ç«¹å | |-align=center |R30||[[Guandu Station|Guandu]]||éæ¸¡ | |rowspan=8|[[Beitou District|Beitou]]||rowspan=18|[[Taipei]] |-align=center |R29||[[Zhongyi Station|Zhongyi]]||å¿ ç¾© | |-align=center |R28||[[Fuxinggang Station|Fuxinggang]]||å¾©èå´ | |-align=center |R26||[[Beitou Station|Beitou]]||åæ |align=left|â  [[Xinbeitou Branch Line (TRTS)|Xinbeitou Branch Line]] |-align=center |R25||[[Qiyan Station|Qiyan]]||å¥å²© | |-align=center |R24||[[Qilian Station|Qilian]]||å­å©å²¸ | |-align=center |R23||[[Shipai Station|Shipai]]

''Planned connection to the â [[Xinyi Line (TRTS)|Xinyi Line]] (2012)'' |} ==Future Expansion== With the planned completion of the [[Xinyi Line (TRTS)|Xinyi Line]] in 2012, the Tamsui Line will connect directly through and terminate at [[Elephant Mountain Station|Elephant Mountain]].{{cite web | url=http://www.dorts.gov.tw/english/Network/frame_stage2.htm | title=Second Stage of Taipei MRT (Approved MRT Lines) | publisher= ''Department of Rapid Transit Systems, TCG'' | date=2009-07-04 | accessdate=2009-08-20 }} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{TRTS Routes}} {{TRTS Red Line}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Danshui Line (Trts)}} [[Category:Taipei Metro]] [[Category:Railway lines opened in 1998]] [[id:Rute Danshui]] [[ja:å°åæ·éæ·¡æ°´ç·]] [[ru:ÐÐ¸Ð½Ð¸Ñ ÐÐ°Ð½ÑÑÑÐ¹]] [[zh:å°åæ·éæ·¡æ°´ç·]]
